column1: HDR Data from the GRACE and GRACE-FO JPL RL06Mv2 Mascon Solution
HDR This file contains values that are anomalies relative to April 2002 computed at the Jet Propulsion Laboratory under the
HDR auspices of the NASA MEaSUREs program. The Greenland mass anomalies are generated using GRACE and GRACE-FO data from the JPL RL06Mv2
HDR If you use these data please cite:

column6: and M. M. Watkins (2019) JPL GRACE and GRACE-FO Mascon Ocean

column1: HDR Water Height RL06M CRI Filtered Version 2.0
HDR For information on how the data were generated please refer to:

column7: Improved methods for observing Earth's time variable

column1: HDR mass distribution with GRACE using spherical cap mascons
HDR NOTES (1): Correction for Glacial Isostatic Adjustment (GIA) is from ICE6G-D
HDR NOTES (2): Trend value is derived by performing a weighted least squares fit of an annual
HDR NOTES (3): Monthly uncertainties are computed using measurement errors provided in the JPL RL06Mv2 Solution and considering
HDR            leakage errors in accordance with Wiese et al. (2016)
HDR NOTES (4): The trend uncertainty provides a 1-sigma confidence interval. The calculation considers only the propagation of the monthly uncertainties

column3: and includes GIA uncertainty according to Velicogna et al. (2013)
